intro: Komaroffia divaricata, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features basal leaves that are alternate and often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Komaroffia divaricata is often found in open, sunny habitats like meadows and disturbed soils.
